message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA sunscreen only protects against UVB rays. UVA rays are not blocked by PABA sunscreen, unless it also contains additional ingredients that specifically state so on the label. UVC rays are absorbed by the ozone layer and do not typically reach the earth's surface.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA (Para-aminobenzoic acid) sunscreen only protects against UVB rays, which are the main cause of sunburn and skin cancer. It does not protect against UVA or UVC rays.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA sunscreen provides protection against UVB rays, which are the primary cause of sunburn and skin cancer. It does not protect against UVA or UVC rays, which have shorter and longer wavelengths, respectively.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA (para-aminobenzoic acid) sunscreen protects against UVB (shortwave ultraviolet B) radiation. It does not protect against UVA (longwave ultraviolet A) or UVC (germicidal ultraviolet C) radiation.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA (para-aminobenzoic acid) primarily absorbs UVB (shortwave ultraviolet radiation). Therefore, it protects against UVB but not UVA or UVC.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA sunscreen primarily protects against UVB rays and may have limited efficacy against some UVA rays as well. It does not protect against UVC rays.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA refers specifically to a type of UVB filter, suggesting that it will only protect against UVB rays. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) UVB.

We refer to reputable dermatology websites for help. PABA sunscreen protects the skin against UVB rays, which are responsible for sunburns and some of the damage that can lead to skin cancer. It does not protect against UVC or UVA rays.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA sunscreen only protects against UVB radiation. UVB is the main radiation that causes sunburn, skin damage, and skin cancer, while UVA rays penetrate deeper into the skin and cause premature aging.

We refer to  Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PABA sunscreen mainly provides protection against UVB rays, which are the ones responsible for sunburns and most skin cancers. It does not provide protection against UVA or UVC rays.
